MEMO
TO: Mr. William Harley
W-. Harold Hill
Mr. James Fellowsv^
Mr. Vernon Bronson
FROM: Ji« Etheridge jofota&y'/
SUBJECT: Region II Conference-Planning
Committee Meeting
Half or more of those listed at the bottom of thij Memo
have agreed to try to meet in NAEB offices in Washington at about
9:30 AM, Monday, November 16, for the purpose of planning all de¬
tails of the Annual Region II Conference to be held at Williamsburg
next March 19-21. 5
As I mentioned to some of you in Austin, we will greatly
appreciate it if you could provide us with a meeting room, prefer¬
ably one with a phone, for a period from about 9:30 AM to near
mid-afternoon-though I hope we might be able to finish our con¬
ference-planning work before then.
Certainly we will greatly appreciate it if, in your busy
work schedule, it can be arranged for one or more of you good
national staffers to be with us for a substantial part of this
planning session.
With the Region II Treasury containing only about $130
turned over to me by Gerry Appy, and with the NAEB budget listing
only $200 for assistance to all regional conferences, I wonder if
it might be possible for the Region XI Conference to be held in
connection with some NAEB clinic, workshop or conference for which
some financial assistance may be available? We will deeply appreciate
your consideration of this if it is at all possible. Since the
Region II Conference is to be held relatively close to active
metropolitan ETV aresa in other regions, it is our hope that we can
have considerable inter-regional participation.
